title: ACH Analysis
subtitle: Analysis of Competing Hypotheses - Structured intelligence methodology

define.title: Define Intelligence Question
define.description: A clear, specific question will help generate better hypotheses
define.intelligenceQuestionPlaceholder: e.g., What is Russia's primary strategic objective in Ukraine?
define.questionTip: Good questions are specific, answerable, and intelligence-relevant
define.descriptionPlaceholder: Background context and scope of analysis

generate.title: Generate Hypotheses
generate.description: Create 4-6 competing hypotheses that answer your question
generate.tipsContent: Hypotheses should be mutually exclusive where possible, cover the spectrum of possibilities, and include at least one contrarian view.

evidence.title: Select Evidence
evidence.description: Choose evidence from your library to evaluate against hypotheses
evidence.selectedCount: Selected {{count}} evidence item(s). You can add more evidence after creating the analysis.

matrix.title: Matrix Scoring
matrix.description: You'll score evidence against hypotheses in the next step
matrix.tipsNeutral: Zero (0) = Evidence is neutral or N/A
matrix.tipsInsight: Key insight: The hypothesis with the LEAST contradictory evidence is typically most likely
matrix.question: Question:

review.title: Review & Finalize
review.finishTip: Click "Finish & Score" to create your ACH analysis. You'll be taken to the scoring matrix.

form.hypothesesDesc: Add at least 2 hypotheses to analyze (minimum recommended: 3-5)
form.noHypotheses: No hypotheses added yet. Add at least 2 to begin analysis.

errors.minHypotheses: Please add at least 2 hypotheses for analysis
errors.saveFailed: Failed to save analysis. Please try again.

matrix.addHypothesesToStart: Add hypotheses to your analysis to begin scoring.
matrix.instructionsTitle: How to use the ACH Matrix:
matrix.instruction1: Click any cell to score how evidence supports or contradicts a hypothesis
matrix.instruction4: The hypothesis with the LEAST contradictory evidence is most likely correct
matrix.noEvidenceLinked: No evidence linked yet. Click "Add Evidence" to start scoring.
matrix.weightedTooltip: Weighted by evidence quality (credibility, source classification, confidence)
matrix.principle: Key Principle: The hypothesis with the LEAST contradictory evidence (highest score) is most likely correct.

dialog.title: Score Evidence Against Hypothesis
dialog.question: How does this evidence relate to the hypothesis?

empty.title: No Analyses Found
empty.descriptionStart: Start your intelligence analysis by creating your first ACH matrix.
empty.descriptionFilter: Try adjusting your search criteria or filters.

alerts.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this analysis? This will also delete all hypotheses, evidence links, and scores.
alerts.removeEvidenceConfirm: Remove this evidence from the analysis?
alerts.evidenceHint: Navigate to Evidence Library to add evidence items, then link them to this analysis.

framework.context: ACH is an eight-step procedure grounded in cognitive psychology used by intelligence analysts to identify a set of possible hypotheses, evaluate data that is consistent and inconsistent with each, and select the hypothesis that best fits the data.
